(Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯрдЗрдВрдбреАрдЬ рджреМрд░реЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рднрд╛рд░рддреАрдп рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯ рдЯреАрдо рдХрд╛ рдРрд▓рд╛рди 27 рдЬреВрди рдХреЛ рд╣реЛ рд╕рдХрддрд╛ рд╣реИ. рдЗрд╕ рджреМрд░реЗ рдкрд░ рдХрдИ рдпреБрд╡рд╛ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдбрд╝рд┐рдпреЛрдВ рдХреЛ рдореМрдХрд╛ рдорд┐рд▓ рд╕рдХрддрд╛ рд╣реИ. рднрд╛рд░рддреАрдп рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯ рдмреЛрд░реНрдб рдХреЗ рдкрд╛рд╕ рдпреБрд╡рд╛рдУрдВ рдХреЛ рдкрд░рдЦрдиреЗ рдХрд╛ рдпрд╣ рдЕрдЪреНрдЫрд╛ рдореМрдХрд╛ рд╣реИ. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдХрд╛ рд╡рд┐рдВрдбреАрдЬ рджреМрд░рд╛ 12 рдЬреБрд▓рд╛рдИ рд╕реЗ рд╢реБрд░реВ рд╣реЛрдЧрд╛, рдЬрд╣рд╛рдВ 2 рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдореИрдЪ, 3 рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдФрд░ 5 рдЯреА20 рдЗрдВрдЯрд░рдиреЗрд╢рдирд▓ рдореИрдЪ рдЦреЗрд▓реЗ рдЬрд╛рдиреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯрдЗрдВрдбреАрдЬ рджреМрд░реЗ рдкрд░ рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдХреЗ рдХрдкреНрддрд╛рди рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ (Rohit Sharma), рд╡рд┐рд░рд╛рдЯ рдХреЛрд╣рд▓реА, рдореЛрд╣рдореНрдордж рд╢рдореА рдФрд░ рдореЛрд╣рдореНрдордж рд╕рд┐рд░рд╛рдЬ рдЬреИрд╕реЗ рд╕реАрдирд┐рдпрд░ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдбрд╝рд┐рдпреЛрдВ рдХреЗ рд╕рднреА рдореИрдЪ рдЦреЗрд▓рдиреЗ рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рдирд╣реАрдВ рд╣реИ. рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ рдФрд░ рд╡рд┐рд░рд╛рдЯ рдХреЛрд╣рд▓реА рд╕рд┐рд░реНрдл 2 рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдореИрдЪ рдЦреЗрд▓ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. рдЗрдирдХреЗ рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдФрд░ рдЯреА20 рдореИрдЪреЛрдВ рдХреА рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдЦреЗрд▓рдиреЗ рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рдмрд╣реБрдд рдХрдо рд╣реИ. рд╕рд┐рд░рд╛рдЬ рдФрд░ рд╢рдореА рдХреЛ рднреА рд╡рд░реНрдХрд▓реЛрдб рдореИрдиреЗрдЬрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдХреЗ рддрд╣рдд рдкреВрд░реЗ рдореИрдЪ рдирд╣реАрдВ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдП рдЬрд╛ рд╕рдХрддреЗ. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рд╕рдВрдЬреВ рд╕реИрдорд╕рди, рдпрд╢рд╕реНрд╡реА рдЬрд╛рдпрд╕рд╡рд╛рд▓, рдЙрдорд░рд╛рди рдорд▓рд┐рдХ рдФрд░ рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣ рдЬреИрд╕реЗ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдбрд╝рд┐рдпреЛрдВ рдХреЗ рд╡рдирдбреЗ, рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдФрд░ рдЯреА20 рдЗрдВрдЯрд░рдиреЗрд╢рдирд▓ рдореИрдЪреЛрдВ рдХреА рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдореЗрдВ рд╢рд╛рдорд┐рд▓ рдХрд┐рдП рдЬрд╛рдиреЗ рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рд╣реИ. рд╕реИрдорд╕рди рдФрд░ рдЙрдорд░рд╛рди рдорд▓рд┐рдХ рдХреЗ рд╕рд╛рде рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣ рдХреЛ рд▓рд┐рдорд┐рдЯреЗрдб рдУрд╡рд░ рдХреА рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдореЗрдВ рдореМрдХрд╛ рдорд┐рд▓ рд╕рдХрддрд╛ рд╣реИ рдЬрдмрдХрд┐ рдЬрд╛рдпрд╕рд╡рд╛рд▓ рдФрд░ рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЯреАрдо рдХрд╛ рд╣рд┐рд╕реНрд╕рд╛ рд╣реЛ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рднрд╛рд░рддреАрдп рдЯреАрдо рдореЗрдЬрдмрд╛рди рд╡рд┐рдВрдбреАрдЬ рдХреЗ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдл рдЕрдкрдиреЗ рдЕрднрд┐рдпрд╛рди рдХреА рд╢реБрд░реБрдЖрдд рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рд╕реЗ рдХрд░реЗрдЧреА. рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ рдХреЗ рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЯреАрдо рдХреЗ рдХрдкреНрддрд╛рди рдмрдиреЗ рд░рд╣рдиреЗ рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рд╣реИ. рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдпрджрд┐ рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рдЕрдкрдиреЗ рдмреНрд░реЗрдХ рдХреЛ рдЖрдЧреЗ рдмрдврд╝рд╛рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ рддреЛ рдлрд┐рд░ рдЙрдк рдХрдкреНрддрд╛рди рдЪреЗрддреЗрд╢реНрд╡рд░ рдкреБрдЬрд╛рд░рд╛ рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЯреАрдо рдХреА рдЕрдЧреБрдЖрдИ рдХрд░рддреЗ рд╣реБрдП рджреЗрдЦреЗ рдЬрд╛ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдФрд░ рдЯреА20 рдЯреАрдо рдХреА рдЕрдЧреБрдЖрдИ рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рдкрдВрдбреНрдпрд╛ рдХрд░ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. рдмреАрд╕реАрд╕реАрдЖрдИ рдкрдВрдбреНрдпрд╛ рдХреЛ рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдХреЗ рд░реВрдк рдореЗрдВ рднрд╡рд┐рд╖реНрдп рдХреЗ рддреМрд░ рдкрд░ рджреЗрдЦ рд╕рдХрддреА рд╣реИ. рд╡реЗрдмрд╕рд╛рдЗрдЯ рдЗрдирд╕рд╛рдЗрдбрд╕реНрдкреЛрд░реНрдЯ рдиреЗ рдмреАрд╕реАрд╕реАрдЖрдИ рдХреЗ рдПрдХ рд╕реАрдирд┐рдпрд░ рдЕрдзрд┐рдХрд╛рд░реА рдХреЗ рд╣рд╡рд╛рд▓реЗ рд╕реЗ рд▓рд┐рдЦрд╛ рд╣реИ, ' рдирд┐рд╢реНрдирд┐рддрддреМрд░ рдкрд░ рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рд╡рд┐рдХрд▓реНрдк рдХреЗ рд░реВрдк рдореЗрдВ рд╣реИрдВ рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдореЗрдВ рд╡рд╛рдкрд╕реА рдХреЛ рд▓реЗрдХрд░ рдЙрдиреНрд╣реЗрдВ рд╣реА рдлреИрд╕рд▓рд╛ рд▓реЗрдирд╛ рд╣реИ. рд╕реЗрд▓реЗрдХреНрдЯрд░реНрд╕ рдЙрдиреНрд╣реЗрдВ рд╕рдлреЗрдж рдЬрд░реНрд╕реА рдореЗрдВ рджреЗрдЦрдирд╛ рдЪрд╛рд╣рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рд╕рдмрд╕реЗ рдмрдбрд╝рд╛ рд╕рд╡рд╛рд▓ рдпрд╣ рд╣реИ рдХреНрдпрд╛ рд╡рд╣ рддреАрдиреЛрдВ рдлреЙрд░реНрдореЗрдЯ рдореЗрдВ рдЦреЗрд▓рдиреЗ рдХреА рд╕реНрдерд┐рддрд┐ рдореЗрдВ рд╣реИрдВ.' (Instagram) рдпреБрд╡рд╛ рдУрдкрдирд░ рдЛрддреБрд░рд╛рдЬ рдЧрд╛рдпрдХрд╡рд╛рдбрд╝, рд░рд┐рдВрдХреВ рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣, рд╣рд░реНрд╖рд▓ рдкрдЯреЗрд▓ рдФрд░ рдХреБрд▓рджреАрдк рдпрд╛рджрд╡ рдХреЛ рдЯреА20 рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЯреАрдо рдореЗрдВ рдЬрдЧрд╣ рдорд┐рд▓ рд╕рдХрддреА рд╣реИ┬╖рд╕рдВрдЬреВ рд╕реИрдорд╕рди рдФрд░ рдЗрд╢рд╛рди рдХрд┐рд╢рди рдХреЛ рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдФрд░ рдЯреА20 рдореЗрдВ рдмрддреМрд░ рд╡рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдХреАрдкрд░ рдореМрдХрд╛ рдорд┐рд▓ рд╕рдХрддрд╛ рд╣реИ┬╖(Instagram) 6 рд╕рд╛рд▓ рдореЗрдВ 1 рд╣рд┐рдЯ рдХреЛ рддрд░рд╕реЗ 'рдмрд╛рд╣реБрдмрд▓реА', рдЫреЛрдЯреА рдирд╣реАрдВ рд╣реИ рдлреНрд▓реЙрдк рдХреА рд▓рд┐рд╕реНрдЯ, рдбрд┐рдЬрд╛рд╕реНрдЯрд░ рд░рд╣реАрдВ рдкреНрд░рднрд╛рд╕ рдХреА рдпреЗ 2 рдлрд┐рд▓реНрдореЗрдВ Karan-Drisha Wedding: рджреЗрдУрд▓ рдкрд░рд┐рд╡рд╛рд░ рдореЗрдВ рд╢рд╛рдорд┐рд▓ рд╣реБрдИрдВ рджреГрд╢рд╛, рд╕рд╕реБрд░ рд╕рдиреА рдиреЗ рдХрд┐рдпрд╛ рд╕реНрд╡рд╛рдЧрдд, рдирд╣реАрдВ рдкрд╣реБрдВрдЪрд╛ рд╣реЗрдорд╛ рдХрд╛ рдкрд░рд┐рд╡рд╛рд░ рджрд┐рди рдХреЗ рдЕрдиреБрд╕рд╛рд░ рд╣реЛрддреА рд╣реИ рд╡реГрдХреНрд╖ рдХреА рдкреВрдЬрд╛, 90% рд▓реЛрдЧ рдирд╣реАрдВ рдЬрд╛рдирддреЗ, рдЦреБрд▓ рдЬрд╛рдПрдЧрд╛ рдмрдВрдж рдХрд┐рд╕реНрдордд рдХрд╛ рддрд╛рд▓рд╛, рджреВрд░ рд╣реЛрдЧреА рд╣рд░ рдкрд░реЗрд╢рд╛рдиреА рднрд╛рд░рдд рдФрд░ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯрдЗрдВрдбреАрдЬ (IND vs WI) рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ 2 рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ, 3 рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдФрд░ 5 рдореИрдЪреЛрдВ рдХреА рдЯреА20 рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдЦреЗрд▓реА рдЬрд╛рдПрдЧреА. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рджреМрд░реЗ рдХреА рд╢реБрд░реБрдЖрдд рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдореИрдЪ рд╕реЗ рдХрд░реЗрдЧреА. рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдХрд╛ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдореИрдЪ 12 рдЬреБрд▓рд╛рдИ рд╕реЗ рдЦреЗрд▓рд╛ рдЬрд╛рдПрдЧрд╛. newsArray.title: IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction: 3 players you can pick as captain or vice-captain for todayтАЩs ICC ODI WC Qualifiers match тАУ June 19, 2023
creator: Sportz Connect
newsArray.content: The fourth match of the 2023 ICC World Cup will see Ireland come head-to-head with Oman at Bulawayo Athletic Sports Club. The game is scheduled to commence on June 19 at 12:30 PM IST. Both teams would look to kickstart their Qualifier campaign with a bang. Interestingly enough, this will be the first time that the two teams will go head-to-head in ODI cricket. Ireland are going into this fixture after two series defeats, both coming against Bangladesh. Besides, they did not have much luck in their one-off test match against England as they ran out of steam against a powerful England line-up. They would be looking to brush aside their past defeats and focus on getting past Oman in their opening game of the tournament. Oman have not been in such great form either. They have only managed to win only two out of 5 ODI games played. They are yet to register a single ODI victory this year and have their task cut out as they prepare to take on Ireland. As we head into this exciting contest, let us preview the top 3 players you can pick as your captain or vice-captain for the IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction match. Jatinder Singh has played a few impressive knocks in the past. He is the leading run-scorer for Oman this year and averages 31.21 with a career-best score of 118*. In addition, Singh has three centuries and six fifties to his name, making him a very compact batsman. With such promising numbers to his name, he is worth trying as a captain or vice-captain in your IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction team. Andy Balbirnie has certainly matured as a cricketer and also as a skipper in the post-covid era. He has the ability to bat long innings and has demonstrated his worth with the bat on numerous occasions. He has an outstanding career-best score of 145* and averages nearly 33 with the bat, with eight centuries and 14 fifties. Harry Tector has an impressive record in ODI cricket and has made significant contributions for his national side across all three formats in recent times. In 30 ODI innings, he has amassed 1,280 runs at a stunning average of 53.33 whilst striking it at 83. He currently holds four centuries and eight half-centuries to his name. Tector has the ability to flatten any bowling opposition. Hence, he should surely be the man to watch out for as he can be the captain or vice-captain in your IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction match. newsArray.content: The fourth match of the ECS Romania T10 league is all set to kick off between ACCB and Bucharest Gladiators on June 19. The game is scheduled to start at 5:45 PM IST at Moara Vlasiei Cricket Ground in Bucharest. It will be the first game for both teams and they would be eyeing for a comfortable win to kickstart their journey in this yearтАЩs ECS edition. The last game that the two played in 2022 saw Bucharest Gladiators sail to a dominating nine-wicket victory with more than four overs to spare. It will also be interesting to see how these two teams approach this upcoming fixture. As we gear up for this epic showdown, let us look at the top three players whom you can select as your captain or vice-captain for the ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction match. Amar is a fairly capable all-rounder who has made some pretty handy contributions with the bat and the ball in recent editions. Since 2021, Amar has featured in 43 T10 games and garnered over 350 runs at a strike rate of 128.31. Besides, he has scalped 30 wickets, with an astounding average of 15.13. Considering his potency with the bat and the ball, Amar can be a true match-winner for his side. He should surely be one of your top picks in your ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction match as a captain or vice-captain. Moiz is a highly qualified all-rounder who can stun any opposition with his all-round skills. He has scored 822 runs in 31 T10 games at an astronomical strike rate of 234.85 which includes his career-best score of 58. He can be equally devastating with the ball and has picked up 27 wickets at a jaw-dropping strike rate of just 12.22. Gohar is a very capable batsman who can entertain the crowd with his power-hitting abilities. He bats with a scintillating strike rate of 213.29 and averages just over 25 in the T10 circuit. In just 34 T10 innings, the 34-year-old has clobbered 802 runs, with 60 fours and 73 sixes. Gohar can send chills down the spine of any bowler. He should most definitely be the man to watch out for in your ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction team as a captain or a vice-captain. newsArray.title: [Pictures] Ravindra Jadeja shares snapshots with his тАШforever crushтАЩ
creator: James Kuanal
newsArray.content: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is enjoying quality time with his family at his hometown in Jamnagar in Gujarat after the ICC World Test Championship final in England. The Saurashtra, who loves horseriding, shared pictures of his reunion with one of his horses at his farmhouse. In multiple pictures shared on Twitter, the 34-year-old can be seen wearing a red T-shirt and blue track pants with sports shoes and a cap next to his black-colored horse. Jadeja captioned the post: In an old interview, Ravindra Jadeja said that he loved spending time with horses in his farmhouse. On the professional front, Jadeja last played for Team India during the WTC final. The all-rounder scalped four wickets and scored 48 runs, but they were not enough, as his team fell short by 209 runs on the final day of the summit clash. Jadeja, though, enjoyed a successful season for champions Chennai Super Kings in the latest edition of the Indian Premier League. The left-arm spinner scalped 20 wickets in 14 games at an economy rate of 7.56. He also contributed 190 runs in 16 games at a stunning strike rate of 142.85. The left-handed batter finished CSKтАЩs innings against Gujarat Titans , when his team required ten runs off two deliveries against Mohit Sharma in the final. Ravindra Jadeja will next be seen in action for Team India during the West Indies tour next month. India are slated to play two Tests, three ODIs and five T20Is during the month-long tour. The all-rounder will look to carry his sublime form ahead of the 2023 ODI World Cup on home soil later this year. Get IPL 2023 Live Score along with Points Table & Schedule Updates at Sportskeeda. newsArray.title: What happened on Day 3 of 1st ENG vs AUS Ashes 2023 Test?
creator: Renin Wilben Albert
newsArray.content: England stumbled to 28/2 in their second innings on a rain-marred Day 3 of the first Ashes 2023 Test at Edgbaston in Birmingham on Sunday, June 18. Earlier in the day, England bowled out Australia for 386 in their first innings. However, Australia hit back with the ball to even out things. When rain forced play to be called off after only 10.3 overs were possible in England's second innings, their lead was just 35 runs. EnglandтАЩs openers survived 6.5 overs and added 26 runs when rain stopped play for the first time. On resumption, AustraliaтАЩs bowlers dismissed both openers. Ben Duckett (19) had a loose jab at a length delivery from Pat Cummins in the channel. He only managed a nick and тАШgully boyтАЩ Cameron Green pulled off another one-handed stunner. Scott Boland then produced a beauty to dismiss Zak Crawley (7). The Australian pacer got one to angle in and then straighten. The England opener had no answer to the brilliant delivery and could only edge the ball behind the stumps. No further play was possible after rain interrupted proceedings again. At Stumps on Day 3, Ollie Pope (0*) and Joe Root (0*) were at the crease. Earlier, Australia resumed their first innings on 311/5. England could have dismissed Alex Carey in the first over of the day as he nicked a delivery from James Anderson. However, Jonny Bairstow dropped the catch, going low to his right with one hand. A couple of overs later, the Aussie keeper-batter smashed Anderson for consecutive fours. However, the England legend ended CareyтАЩs resistance on 66, knocking him over with a beauty. A wobble-seam delivery nipped back in and crashed through the batterтАЩs defense. Australian captain Cummins came in and hammered Moeen Ali for two sixes in an over. A brilliant piece of captaincy from Ben Stokes, however, ended Usman KhawajaтАЩs long vigil for 141. England placed a front-of-the-wicket umbrella field, and the Aussie opener tried to break the stranglehold by stepping out. He ended up yorking himself off Ollie RobinsonтАЩs bowling. Nathan Lyon (1) also perished to Robinson, pulling a short ball from the England pacer to deep square leg. In the next over, Boland (0) fended a well-directed bouncer from Stuart Broad straight to silly point. Cummins struck the fast bowler for a six as Broad attempted another short ball. His valuable effort, however, ended on 38 as he miscued a hook off Robinson. Despite the skipperтАЩs resistance, Australia had a poor first session, losing four wickets for 14 runs and conceding a first-innings lead of seven runs. newsArray.title: IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction: 3 players you can pick as captain or vice-captain for todayтАЩs ICC ODI WC Qualifiers match тАУ June 19, 2023
creator: Sportz Connect
newsArray.content: The fourth match of the 2023 ICC World Cup will see Ireland come head-to-head with Oman at Bulawayo Athletic Sports Club. The game is scheduled to commence on June 19 at 12:30 PM IST. Both teams would look to kickstart their Qualifier campaign with a bang. Interestingly enough, this will be the first time that the two teams will go head-to-head in ODI cricket. Ireland are going into this fixture after two series defeats, both coming against Bangladesh. Besides, they did not have much luck in their one-off test match against England as they ran out of steam against a powerful England line-up. They would be looking to brush aside their past defeats and focus on getting past Oman in their opening game of the tournament. Oman have not been in such great form either. They have only managed to win only two out of 5 ODI games played. They are yet to register a single ODI victory this year and have their task cut out as they prepare to take on Ireland. As we head into this exciting contest, let us preview the top 3 players you can pick as your captain or vice-captain for the IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction match. Jatinder Singh has played a few impressive knocks in the past. He is the leading run-scorer for Oman this year and averages 31.21 with a career-best score of 118*. In addition, Singh has three centuries and six fifties to his name, making him a very compact batsman. With such promising numbers to his name, he is worth trying as a captain or vice-captain in your IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction team. Andy Balbirnie has certainly matured as a cricketer and also as a skipper in the post-covid era. He has the ability to bat long innings and has demonstrated his worth with the bat on numerous occasions. He has an outstanding career-best score of 145* and averages nearly 33 with the bat, with eight centuries and 14 fifties. Harry Tector has an impressive record in ODI cricket and has made significant contributions for his national side across all three formats in recent times. In 30 ODI innings, he has amassed 1,280 runs at a stunning average of 53.33 whilst striking it at 83. He currently holds four centuries and eight half-centuries to his name. Tector has the ability to flatten any bowling opposition. Hence, he should surely be the man to watch out for as he can be the captain or vice-captain in your IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction match. newsArray.title: ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction: 3 players you can pick as captain or vice-captain for todayтАЩs ECS Romania T10 match тАУ June 19, 2023
creator: Sportz Connect
newsArray.content: The fourth match of the ECS Romania T10 league is all set to kick off between ACCB and Bucharest Gladiators on June 19. The game is scheduled to start at 5:45 PM IST at Moara Vlasiei Cricket Ground in Bucharest. It will be the first game for both teams and they would be eyeing for a comfortable win to kickstart their journey in this yearтАЩs ECS edition. The last game that the two played in 2022 saw Bucharest Gladiators sail to a dominating nine-wicket victory with more than four overs to spare. It will also be interesting to see how these two teams approach this upcoming fixture. As we gear up for this epic showdown, let us look at the top three players whom you can select as your captain or vice-captain for the ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction match. Amar is a fairly capable all-rounder who has made some pretty handy contributions with the bat and the ball in recent editions. Since 2021, Amar has featured in 43 T10 games and garnered over 350 runs at a strike rate of 128.31. Besides, he has scalped 30 wickets, with an astounding average of 15.13. Considering his potency with the bat and the ball, Amar can be a true match-winner for his side. He should surely be one of your top picks in your ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction match as a captain or vice-captain. Moiz is a highly qualified all-rounder who can stun any opposition with his all-round skills. He has scored 822 runs in 31 T10 games at an astronomical strike rate of 234.85 which includes his career-best score of 58. He can be equally devastating with the ball and has picked up 27 wickets at a jaw-dropping strike rate of just 12.22. Gohar is a very capable batsman who can entertain the crowd with his power-hitting abilities. He bats with a scintillating strike rate of 213.29 and averages just over 25 in the T10 circuit. In just 34 T10 innings, the 34-year-old has clobbered 802 runs, with 60 fours and 73 sixes. Gohar can send chills down the spine of any bowler. He should most definitely be the man to watch out for in your ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction team as a captain or a vice-captain. He bowls with good lines and lengths consistently and never allows the batters of the opposition team to settle down at the crease and score big runs. His wicket-taking ability makes him a must-have pick to be made the captain or vice-captain in your Dream11 team for the CL vs BKW game on Monday. The right-handed batter has the ability to play patient knocks for his team and hold fort strongly. newsArray.title: [Pictures] Ravindra Jadeja shares snapshots with his тАШforever crushтАЩ
creator: James Kuanal
newsArray.content: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is enjoying quality time with his family at his hometown in Jamnagar in Gujarat after the ICC World Test Championship final in England. The Saurashtra, who loves horseriding, shared pictures of his reunion with one of his horses at his farmhouse. In multiple pictures shared on Twitter, the 34-year-old can be seen wearing a red T-shirt and blue track pants with sports shoes and a cap next to his black-colored horse. Jadeja captioned the post: In an old interview, Ravindra Jadeja said that he loved spending time with horses in his farmhouse. On the professional front, Jadeja last played for Team India during the WTC final. The all-rounder scalped four wickets and scored 48 runs, but they were not enough, as his team fell short by 209 runs on the final day of the summit clash. Jadeja, though, enjoyed a successful season for champions Chennai Super Kings in the latest edition of the Indian Premier League. The left-arm spinner scalped 20 wickets in 14 games at an economy rate of 7.56. He also contributed 190 runs in 16 games at a stunning strike rate of 142.85. The left-handed batter finished CSKтАЩs innings against Gujarat Titans , when his team required ten runs off two deliveries against Mohit Sharma in the final. Ravindra Jadeja will next be seen in action for Team India during the West Indies tour next month. India are slated to play two Tests, three ODIs and five T20Is during the month-long tour. The all-rounder will look to carry his sublime form ahead of the 2023 ODI World Cup on home soil later this year. Get IPL 2023 Live Score along with Points Table & Schedule Updates at Sportskeeda. newsArray.title: What happened on Day 3 of 1st ENG vs AUS Ashes 2023 Test?
creator: Renin Wilben Albert
newsArray.content: England stumbled to 28/2 in their second innings on a rain-marred Day 3 of the first Ashes 2023 Test at Edgbaston in Birmingham on Sunday, June 18. Earlier in the day, England bowled out Australia for 386 in their first innings. However, Australia hit back with the ball to even out things. When rain forced play to be called off after only 10.3 overs were possible in England's second innings, their lead was just 35 runs. EnglandтАЩs openers survived 6.5 overs and added 26 runs when rain stopped play for the first time. On resumption, AustraliaтАЩs bowlers dismissed both openers. Ben Duckett (19) had a loose jab at a length delivery from Pat Cummins in the channel. He only managed a nick and тАШgully boyтАЩ Cameron Green pulled off another one-handed stunner. Scott Boland then produced a beauty to dismiss Zak Crawley (7). The Australian pacer got one to angle in and then straighten. The England opener had no answer to the brilliant delivery and could only edge the ball behind the stumps. No further play was possible after rain interrupted proceedings again. At Stumps on Day 3, Ollie Pope (0*) and Joe Root (0*) were at the crease. Earlier, Australia resumed their first innings on 311/5. England could have dismissed Alex Carey in the first over of the day as he nicked a delivery from James Anderson. However, Jonny Bairstow dropped the catch, going low to his right with one hand. A couple of overs later, the Aussie keeper-batter smashed Anderson for consecutive fours. However, the England legend ended CareyтАЩs resistance on 66, knocking him over with a beauty. A wobble-seam delivery nipped back in and crashed through the batterтАЩs defense. Australian captain Cummins came in and hammered Moeen Ali for two sixes in an over. A brilliant piece of captaincy from Ben Stokes, however, ended Usman KhawajaтАЩs long vigil for 141. England placed a front-of-the-wicket umbrella field, and the Aussie opener tried to break the stranglehold by stepping out. He ended up yorking himself off Ollie RobinsonтАЩs bowling. Nathan Lyon (1) also perished to Robinson, pulling a short ball from the England pacer to deep square leg. In the next over, Boland (0) fended a well-directed bouncer from Stuart Broad straight to silly point. Cummins struck the fast bowler for a six as Broad attempted another short ball. His valuable effort, however, ended on 38 as he miscued a hook off Robinson. Despite the skipperтАЩs resistance, Australia had a poor first session, losing four wickets for 14 runs and conceding a first-innings lead of seven runs. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯрдЗрдВрдбреАрдЬ рджреМрд░реЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рднрд╛рд░рддреАрдп рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯ рдЯреАрдо рдХрд╛ рдРрд▓рд╛рди 27 рдЬреВрди рдХреЛ рд╣реЛ рд╕рдХрддрд╛ рд╣реИ. рдЗрд╕ рджреМрд░реЗ рдкрд░ рдХрдИ рдпреБрд╡рд╛ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдбрд╝рд┐рдпреЛрдВ рдХреЛ рдореМрдХрд╛ рдорд┐рд▓ рд╕рдХрддрд╛ рд╣реИ. рднрд╛рд░рддреАрдп рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯ рдмреЛрд░реНрдб рдХреЗ рдкрд╛рд╕ рдпреБрд╡рд╛рдУрдВ рдХреЛ рдкрд░рдЦрдиреЗ рдХрд╛ рдпрд╣ рдЕрдЪреНрдЫрд╛ рдореМрдХрд╛ рд╣реИ. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдХрд╛ рд╡рд┐рдВрдбреАрдЬ рджреМрд░рд╛ 12 рдЬреБрд▓рд╛рдИ рд╕реЗ рд╢реБрд░реВ рд╣реЛрдЧрд╛, рдЬрд╣рд╛рдВ 2 рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдореИрдЪ, 3 рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдФрд░ 5 рдЯреА20 рдЗрдВрдЯрд░рдиреЗрд╢рдирд▓ рдореИрдЪ рдЦреЗрд▓реЗ рдЬрд╛рдиреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯрдЗрдВрдбреАрдЬ рджреМрд░реЗ рдкрд░ рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдХреЗ рдХрдкреНрддрд╛рди рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ (Rohit Sharma), рд╡рд┐рд░рд╛рдЯ рдХреЛрд╣рд▓реА, рдореЛрд╣рдореНрдордж рд╢рдореА рдФрд░ рдореЛрд╣рдореНрдордж рд╕рд┐рд░рд╛рдЬ рдЬреИрд╕реЗ рд╕реАрдирд┐рдпрд░ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдбрд╝рд┐рдпреЛрдВ рдХреЗ рд╕рднреА рдореИрдЪ рдЦреЗрд▓рдиреЗ рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рдирд╣реАрдВ рд╣реИ. рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ рдФрд░ рд╡рд┐рд░рд╛рдЯ рдХреЛрд╣рд▓реА рд╕рд┐рд░реНрдл 2 рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдореИрдЪ рдЦреЗрд▓ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. рдЗрдирдХреЗ рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдФрд░ рдЯреА20 рдореИрдЪреЛрдВ рдХреА рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдЦреЗрд▓рдиреЗ рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рдмрд╣реБрдд рдХрдо рд╣реИ. рд╕рд┐рд░рд╛рдЬ рдФрд░ рд╢рдореА рдХреЛ рднреА рд╡рд░реНрдХрд▓реЛрдб рдореИрдиреЗрдЬрдореЗрдВрдЯ рдХреЗ рддрд╣рдд рдкреВрд░реЗ рдореИрдЪ рдирд╣реАрдВ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдП рдЬрд╛ рд╕рдХрддреЗ. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рд╕рдВрдЬреВ рд╕реИрдорд╕рди, рдпрд╢рд╕реНрд╡реА рдЬрд╛рдпрд╕рд╡рд╛рд▓, рдЙрдорд░рд╛рди рдорд▓рд┐рдХ рдФрд░ рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣ рдЬреИрд╕реЗ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдбрд╝рд┐рдпреЛрдВ рдХреЗ рд╡рдирдбреЗ, рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдФрд░ рдЯреА20 рдЗрдВрдЯрд░рдиреЗрд╢рдирд▓ рдореИрдЪреЛрдВ рдХреА рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдореЗрдВ рд╢рд╛рдорд┐рд▓ рдХрд┐рдП рдЬрд╛рдиреЗ рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рд╣реИ. рд╕реИрдорд╕рди рдФрд░ рдЙрдорд░рд╛рди рдорд▓рд┐рдХ рдХреЗ рд╕рд╛рде рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣ рдХреЛ рд▓рд┐рдорд┐рдЯреЗрдб рдУрд╡рд░ рдХреА рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдореЗрдВ рдореМрдХрд╛ рдорд┐рд▓ рд╕рдХрддрд╛ рд╣реИ рдЬрдмрдХрд┐ рдЬрд╛рдпрд╕рд╡рд╛рд▓ рдФрд░ рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЯреАрдо рдХрд╛ рд╣рд┐рд╕реНрд╕рд╛ рд╣реЛ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рднрд╛рд░рддреАрдп рдЯреАрдо рдореЗрдЬрдмрд╛рди рд╡рд┐рдВрдбреАрдЬ рдХреЗ рдЦрд┐рд▓рд╛рдл рдЕрдкрдиреЗ рдЕрднрд┐рдпрд╛рди рдХреА рд╢реБрд░реБрдЖрдд рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬ рд╕реЗ рдХрд░реЗрдЧреА. рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ рдХреЗ рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЯреАрдо рдХреЗ рдХрдкреНрддрд╛рди рдмрдиреЗ рд░рд╣рдиреЗ рдХреА рдЙрдореНрдореАрдж рд╣реИ. рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдпрджрд┐ рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рдЕрдкрдиреЗ рдмреНрд░реЗрдХ рдХреЛ рдЖрдЧреЗ рдмрдврд╝рд╛рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ рддреЛ рдлрд┐рд░ рдЙрдк рдХрдкреНрддрд╛рди рдЪреЗрддреЗрд╢реНрд╡рд░ рдкреБрдЬрд╛рд░рд╛ рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЯреАрдо рдХреА рдЕрдЧреБрдЖрдИ рдХрд░рддреЗ рд╣реБрдП рджреЗрдЦреЗ рдЬрд╛ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. (Indiancricketteam/Instagram) рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдФрд░ рдЯреА20 рдЯреАрдо рдХреА рдЕрдЧреБрдЖрдИ рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рдкрдВрдбреНрдпрд╛ рдХрд░ рд╕рдХрддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. рдмреАрд╕реАрд╕реАрдЖрдИ рдкрдВрдбреНрдпрд╛ рдХреЛ рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдХреЗ рд░реВрдк рдореЗрдВ рднрд╡рд┐рд╖реНрдп рдХреЗ рддреМрд░ рдкрд░ рджреЗрдЦ рд╕рдХрддреА рд╣реИ. рд╡реЗрдмрд╕рд╛рдЗрдЯ рдЗрдирд╕рд╛рдЗрдбрд╕реНрдкреЛрд░реНрдЯ рдиреЗ рдмреАрд╕реАрд╕реАрдЖрдИ рдХреЗ рдПрдХ рд╕реАрдирд┐рдпрд░ рдЕрдзрд┐рдХрд╛рд░реА рдХреЗ рд╣рд╡рд╛рд▓реЗ рд╕реЗ рд▓рд┐рдЦрд╛ рд╣реИ, ' рдирд┐рд╢реНрдирд┐рддрддреМрд░ рдкрд░ рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рд╡рд┐рдХрд▓реНрдк рдХреЗ рд░реВрдк рдореЗрдВ рд╣реИрдВ рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдЯреЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдореЗрдВ рд╡рд╛рдкрд╕реА рдХреЛ рд▓реЗрдХрд░ рдЙрдиреНрд╣реЗрдВ рд╣реА рдлреИрд╕рд▓рд╛ рд▓реЗрдирд╛ рд╣реИ. рд╕реЗрд▓реЗрдХреНрдЯрд░реНрд╕ рдЙрдиреНрд╣реЗрдВ рд╕рдлреЗрдж рдЬрд░реНрд╕реА рдореЗрдВ рджреЗрдЦрдирд╛ рдЪрд╛рд╣рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ. рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рд╕рдмрд╕реЗ рдмрдбрд╝рд╛ рд╕рд╡рд╛рд▓ рдпрд╣ рд╣реИ рдХреНрдпрд╛ рд╡рд╣ рддреАрдиреЛрдВ рдлреЙрд░реНрдореЗрдЯ рдореЗрдВ рдЦреЗрд▓рдиреЗ рдХреА рд╕реНрдерд┐рддрд┐ рдореЗрдВ рд╣реИрдВ.' newsArray.title: IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction: 3 players you can pick as captain or vice-captain for todayтАЩs ICC ODI WC Qualifiers match тАУ June 19, 2023
creator: Sportz Connect
newsArray.content: The fourth match of the 2023 ICC World Cup will see Ireland come head-to-head with Oman at Bulawayo Athletic Sports Club. The game is scheduled to commence on June 19 at 12:30 PM IST. Both teams would look to kickstart their Qualifier campaign with a bang. Interestingly enough, this will be the first time that the two teams will go head-to-head in ODI cricket. Ireland are going into this fixture after two series defeats, both coming against Bangladesh. Besides, they did not have much luck in their one-off test match against England as they ran out of steam against a powerful England line-up. They would be looking to brush aside their past defeats and focus on getting past Oman in their opening game of the tournament. Oman have not been in such great form either. They have only managed to win only two out of 5 ODI games played. They are yet to register a single ODI victory this year and have their task cut out as they prepare to take on Ireland. As we head into this exciting contest, let us preview the top 3 players you can pick as your captain or vice-captain for the IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction match. Jatinder Singh has played a few impressive knocks in the past. He is the leading run-scorer for Oman this year and averages 31.21 with a career-best score of 118*. In addition, Singh has three centuries and six fifties to his name, making him a very compact batsman. With such promising numbers to his name, he is worth trying as a captain or vice-captain in your IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction team. Andy Balbirnie has certainly matured as a cricketer and also as a skipper in the post-covid era. He has the ability to bat long innings and has demonstrated his worth with the bat on numerous occasions. He has an outstanding career-best score of 145* and averages nearly 33 with the bat, with eight centuries and 14 fifties. Harry Tector has an impressive record in ODI cricket and has made significant contributions for his national side across all three formats in recent times. In 30 ODI innings, he has amassed 1,280 runs at a stunning average of 53.33 whilst striking it at 83. He currently holds four centuries and eight half-centuries to his name. Tector has the ability to flatten any bowling opposition. Hence, he should surely be the man to watch out for as he can be the captain or vice-captain in your IRE vs OMN Dream11 prediction match. newsArray.title: ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction: 3 players you can pick as captain or vice-captain for todayтАЩs ECS Romania T10 match тАУ June 19, 2023
creator: Sportz Connect
newsArray.content: The fourth match of the ECS Romania T10 league is all set to kick off between ACCB and Bucharest Gladiators on June 19. The game is scheduled to start at 5:45 PM IST at Moara Vlasiei Cricket Ground in Bucharest. It will be the first game for both teams and they would be eyeing for a comfortable win to kickstart their journey in this yearтАЩs ECS edition. The last game that the two played in 2022 saw Bucharest Gladiators sail to a dominating nine-wicket victory with more than four overs to spare. It will also be interesting to see how these two teams approach this upcoming fixture. As we gear up for this epic showdown, let us look at the top three players whom you can select as your captain or vice-captain for the ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction match. Amar is a fairly capable all-rounder who has made some pretty handy contributions with the bat and the ball in recent editions. Since 2021, Amar has featured in 43 T10 games and garnered over 350 runs at a strike rate of 128.31. Besides, he has scalped 30 wickets, with an astounding average of 15.13. Considering his potency with the bat and the ball, Amar can be a true match-winner for his side. He should surely be one of your top picks in your ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction match as a captain or vice-captain. Moiz is a highly qualified all-rounder who can stun any opposition with his all-round skills. He has scored 822 runs in 31 T10 games at an astronomical strike rate of 234.85 which includes his career-best score of 58. He can be equally devastating with the ball and has picked up 27 wickets at a jaw-dropping strike rate of just 12.22. Gohar is a very capable batsman who can entertain the crowd with his power-hitting abilities. He bats with a scintillating strike rate of 213.29 and averages just over 25 in the T10 circuit. In just 34 T10 innings, the 34-year-old has clobbered 802 runs, with 60 fours and 73 sixes. Gohar can send chills down the spine of any bowler. He should most definitely be the man to watch out for in your ACCB vs BUG Dream11 prediction team as a captain or a vice-captain. newsArray.content: Chinnamasta Lions (CL) and Bajaj Khadak Warriors (BKW) square off against in the third game of the Saptari T20 Premier League at the Rajbiraj Stadium in Nepal on Monday (June 19). Both teams have announced strong squads for the tournament with a mixture of youth and experience and will look to start their campaign on a high. On that note, here are three players whom you could pick as captain or vice-captain in your Dream11 team for the CL vs BKW game. Adhikari is a talented all-rounder who can contribute significantly with both bat and ball. In three games, the 19-year-old youngster has notched up five wickets at an impressive economy rate. He can also score useful runs with the bat, making him a decent pick for the CL vs BKW Dream11 fantasy team. Khatri has a great ability to swing the new ball in the powerplay. He bowls with good lines and lengths consistently and never allows the batters of the opposition team to settle down at the crease and score big runs. His wicket-taking ability makes him a must-have pick to be made the captain or vice-captain in your Dream11 team for the CL vs BKW game on Monday. Sharad Vesawkar is an experienced campaigner who has represented the Nepal team in 20 games at the international level. For his national team, Vesawkar has notched up 325 runs at an average of 23.21 and a strike rate of nearly 100. The right-handed batter has the ability to play patient knocks for his team and hold fort strongly. newsArray.title: [Pictures] Ravindra Jadeja shares snapshots with his тАШforever crushтАЩ
creator: James Kuanal
newsArray.content: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is enjoying quality time with his family at his hometown in Jamnagar in Gujarat after the ICC World Test Championship final in England. The Saurashtra, who loves horseriding, shared pictures of his reunion with one of his horses at his farmhouse. In multiple pictures shared on Twitter, the 34-year-old can be seen wearing a red T-shirt and blue track pants with sports shoes and a cap next to his black-colored horse. Jadeja captioned the post: In an old interview, Ravindra Jadeja said that he loved spending time with horses in his farmhouse. On the professional front, Jadeja last played for Team India during the WTC final. The all-rounder scalped four wickets and scored 48 runs, but they were not enough, as his team fell short by 209 runs on the final day of the summit clash. Jadeja, though, enjoyed a successful season for champions Chennai Super Kings in the latest edition of the Indian Premier League. The left-arm spinner scalped 20 wickets in 14 games at an economy rate of 7.56. He also contributed 190 runs in 16 games at a stunning strike rate of 142.85. The left-handed batter finished CSKтАЩs innings against Gujarat Titans , when his team required ten runs off two deliveries against Mohit Sharma in the final. Ravindra Jadeja will next be seen in action for Team India during the West Indies tour next month. India are slated to play two Tests, three ODIs and five T20Is during the month-long tour. The all-rounder will look to carry his sublime form ahead of the 2023 ODI World Cup on home soil later this year. Get IPL 2023 Live Score along with Points Table & Schedule Updates at Sportskeeda. newsArray.title: What happened on Day 3 of 1st ENG vs AUS Ashes 2023 Test?
creator: Renin Wilben Albert
newsArray.content: England stumbled to 28/2 in their second innings on a rain-marred Day 3 of the first Ashes 2023 Test at Edgbaston in Birmingham on Sunday, June 18. Earlier in the day, England bowled out Australia for 386 in their first innings. However, Australia hit back with the ball to even out things. When rain forced play to be called off after only 10.3 overs were possible in England's second innings, their lead was just 35 runs. EnglandтАЩs openers survived 6.5 overs and added 26 runs when rain stopped play for the first time. On resumption, AustraliaтАЩs bowlers dismissed both openers. Ben Duckett (19) had a loose jab at a length delivery from Pat Cummins in the channel. He only managed a nick and тАШgully boyтАЩ Cameron Green pulled off another one-handed stunner. Scott Boland then produced a beauty to dismiss Zak Crawley (7). The Australian pacer got one to angle in and then straighten. The England opener had no answer to the brilliant delivery and could only edge the ball behind the stumps. No further play was possible after rain interrupted proceedings again. At Stumps on Day 3, Ollie Pope (0*) and Joe Root (0*) were at the crease. Earlier, Australia resumed their first innings on 311/5. England could have dismissed Alex Carey in the first over of the day as he nicked a delivery from James Anderson. However, Jonny Bairstow dropped the catch, going low to his right with one hand. A couple of overs later, the Aussie keeper-batter smashed Anderson for consecutive fours. However, the England legend ended CareyтАЩs resistance on 66, knocking him over with a beauty. A wobble-seam delivery nipped back in and crashed through the batterтАЩs defense. Australian captain Cummins came in and hammered Moeen Ali for two sixes in an over. A brilliant piece of captaincy from Ben Stokes, however, ended Usman KhawajaтАЩs long vigil for 141. England placed a front-of-the-wicket umbrella field, and the Aussie opener tried to break the stranglehold by stepping out. He ended up yorking himself off Ollie RobinsonтАЩs bowling. Nathan Lyon (1) also perished to Robinson, pulling a short ball from the England pacer to deep square leg. In the next over, Boland (0) fended a well-directed bouncer from Stuart Broad straight to silly point. Cummins struck the fast bowler for a six as Broad attempted another short ball. His valuable effort, however, ended on 38 as he miscued a hook off Robinson. Despite the skipperтАЩs resistance, Australia had a poor first session, losing four wickets for 14 runs and conceding a first-innings lead of seven runs.
